title: 108_hr5226
content:
CROP DISASTER ASSISTANCE. In this section, definitions are provided for terms like "additional coverage," "insurable commodity," and "noninsurable commodity." The Secretary of Agriculture is authorized to use funds for emergency financial assistance to producers on a farm. In accordance with the Federal Crop Insurance Act, the Secretary of Agriculture can provide emergency financial assistance to producers who have suffered crop losses due to weather conditions in 2003 or 2004. The assistance will be administered similarly to previous acts, with specific loss thresholds for qualifying losses. Producers will not be eligible for assistance if they have incurred losses on insurable or noninsurable commodities, except under certain circumstances. Producers on a farm may be ineligible for assistance if they did not obtain insurance for insurable commodities or file paperwork for noninsurable commodities by the required deadlines. The Secretary has the authority to waive these requirements if producers enter into a contract agreeing to obtain insurance. Producers on a farm must enter into a contract with the Secretary agreeing to obtain insurance for insurable commodities and file paperwork for noninsurable commodities for the next 2 crops. Violation of the contract requires reimbursement to the Secretary. Payment limitations apply to assistance provided for crop losses. Payment limitations apply to assistance provided for crop losses, with a maximum of 95 percent of the crop's estimated value in the absence of losses. This includes crop insurance payments and the value of any crops not lost. The value of the crop not lost will be estimated by the Secretary. Assistance under this section will be reduced by any aid received from Florida Disaster Programs for the same loss. SEC. 2. LIVESTOCK ASSISTANCE PROGRAM. The Secretary of Agriculture will provide emergency financial assistance for livestock losses in designated counties for either 2003 or 2004. The assistance will be administered similarly to the American Indian livestock program. Eligibility for payments will not penalize producers. In the Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2001, the Secretary of Agriculture will not penalize producers in the livestock assistance program for actions that reduce the number of livestock owned during disaster conditions. SEC. 3. TREE ASSISTANCE PROGRAM.

The Secretary of Agriculture will use funds from the Commodity Credit Corporation to assist producers who suffered tree losses between December 1, 2003, and December 31, 2004. An additional $15,000,000 will be used to reimburse eligible forest landowners for tree losses under the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002.

SEC. 4. EMERGENCY CONSERVATION PROGRAM. SEC. 4. EMERGENCY CONSERVATION PROGRAM. The Secretary of Agriculture will allocate an extra $50,000,000 from the Commodity Credit Corporation funds for the Emergency Conservation Program. Participants will receive the maximum cost share percentage allowed under regulations. SEC. 5. COMMODITY CREDIT CORPORATION. The Secretary will utilize the Commodity Credit Corporation's resources to implement this Act. SEC. 6. REGULATIONS. SEC. 5. The Secretary of Agriculture will utilize the Commodity Credit Corporation's resources to implement this Act. SEC. 6. The Secretary may promulgate necessary regulations without following certain provisions. SEC. 7. OFFSET. SEC. 7. OFFSET. Amends Section 1241(a)(3) of the Food Security Act of 1985 to allocate $6,037,000,000 for fiscal years 2005 through 2014.
